Lukas S
Accra, Ghana70 contributions
Best bookstore in Asia so far
Sep 2019 • Solo
Unfortunately there aren't many bookstores throughout Vietnam, especially not ones where you can find used books. This here is just the perfect place to find English books of every kind. They also take your old books for a fair price. I was already desperate when because I was running out of books in this country and was happy to find all these interesting titles in that store. The staff was also very friendly and helpful.
Written October 2, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Freestategal
North Bethesda, MD37 contributions
Good place to find English books
Jun 2019 • Family
We went to the Bookworm a few times to look for books in English while we were in Hanoi and always found quite a few. There are also a lot of books on Vietnam. Highly recommended. They also buy used books. I look for used book stores when I am travelling because there is always such variety, and I wasn't disappointed.
Written July 12, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

16 contributions
For book lovers
Mar 2019 • Friends
Accidentally ran into this nice bookstore that sold both old and new books. I couldn’t resist buying few used books.

itchi100
Victoria, Canada15 contributions
Books and more books
Apr 2019 • Couples
We heard about this bookstore from Randy’s Bookstore in Hoi An. Lots of choice in reading material here and a quiet place to take your time to look around. They will buy back your books as well. Very satisfying place to visit if you have running-out-of-things-to-read anxiety. We had no luck with the coffee shop which we were looking forward to as it was a half our walk there from our hotel. They were getting ready for an event, I guess, but did offer to make coffee for us and even bring i5 down to 5he bookstore when it was ready.
Written April 19, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
xlne
Singapore, Singapore716 contributions
A rare collection of English books in Hanoi
Mar 2019 • Solo
Abit hard to spy from the main road but for the small blader indicating it's presence. There were two storeys of English books to browse here. Books by the same author were placed together but all the authors were not catalogued in alphabetical order, so it's abit daunting if you're looking for a particular book. The owner kindly leaves you to your browsing, but was helpful and informative when you need help. Was hoping I could rent books here but turns out I need to buy em back. Also, it seems like many of the books were new so it was not really the cheap second hand bookshop I envision.

On the noticeboard outside, there were many interesting activities like cooking or yoga classes that you can sign up for. There were also some tables outside the bookshop where reading can be done but people walk in and out regularly so it's not an ideal hideout for a bookworm.
Written April 5, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
John D
Adelaide, Australia39 contributions
Good bookshop; Disappointing cafe
Jan 2019 • Couples
I’m a sucker for book exchanges when travelling. Reviews suggested this was the one to visit, along with Randy’s in Hoi An, when in Vietnam. And it was a very good book exchange. Plus had a good range of new books. Plus nice places to sit and read. But reviews had talked about the nice coffee as well. It was raining; coffee In the courtyard, mentioned in several reviews, was not a possibility. The nice lady in the book exchange enthusiastically advised us to go up the external staircase to the actual cafe. “Do you have a reservation?” I was asked as I entered the cafe. “If not we cannot serve you”. But we would be happy with just a couple of takeaway coffees. That didn’t work either. No reservation; no coffee. By the way - there were no customers in the cafe. Maybe there were people, with reservations, expected. But they weren’t there yet. Fortunately, the nice lady in the book exchange directed us to a very nice cafe on the nearby lake where we got lovely coffee. But since when do you need a reservation at a bookshop cafe in order to get a couple of coffees? One star lost from what would otherwise have been a 5-star book exchange rating.
Written March 21, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Anna W
Salt Spring Island, Canada33 contributions
Peaceful Haven with Books in English
Jan 2019 • Solo
Nice selection of books in English if you’re looking for something to read while you travel. Also has great cookbooks and coffee table books if you are looking for something to bring home as a gift or souvenir. There’s a peaceful and reasonably priced restaurant/cafe attached as well.
Written January 31, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Jennifer S
8 contributions
Great little place
Oct 2018 • Couples
Wandered in here on our first day on Hanoi because it had a huge collection of English treats and having been traveling for months my husband was over the moon to get a full English and a good cuppa!

I got the veggie breakfast and the menu is massively suited to vegans as well. Metal straws and all.

We chatted to the owner? From England and he was very helpful and very funny. Ended up booking the Cu Chi Tunnel trip through them and loved that too.

Went back there for breakfast again and had dippy eggs and soldiers and the eggs were cooked to absolute perfection 👌🏼

Title is in the name and there are plently of books there to have a look at along with board games.

Ice coffee was also amazing 🤤
Written October 24, 2018
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
gokcecicek b
Istanbul, Türkiye7 contributions
Oasis in a desert
Sep 2018 • Couples
We stopped by this book shop and cafe for an hour during our visit to Vietnam. One of the cleanest cafes I have seen so far. They have varieties of coffees both Vietnamese and regular. Book prices are at the range of Amazon or slightly higher. Good stop when you are around Truc Bac lake (west lake)
Written September 1, 2018
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Companion532583
1 contribution
AVOID BEING SCAMMED
Aug 2018 • Solo
AVOID THIS STORE!!!

Yes the selection of English books is large for Hanoi, but here are two reasons YOU SHOULD NOT SHOP HERE.

1. The books are overpriced. I don’t want to buy used books at new prices.

2. The owner just tried to scam me for 1,350,000 dong! I purchased a book (used, ok condition, random book with illustrations of SEA’s local snakes) CLEARLY LABELLED (and worth) 150,000 dong. A couple hours later I get an email saying the price is actually 1,500,000 (nearly 65 usd for a used book the equivalent of DK’s big book of reptiles!??!!!) and that if I don’t pay him he will fine the clerk who I checked me out (sob story).

Don’t give this person your money, either way you’re being scammed.
Written August 26, 2018
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Bookworm H
Thank you for your review of our store. Unfortunately the book you bought was new albiet it had been on the shelves for some time. The price problem arose because we are now shifting all stock online and to do this all books had to be taken off shelves, rebadged and replaced on shelves. Unfortunately the correct price tag for the book (1 5000 000VND) was replaced with one zero omitted. In the normal course of events we take responsibility for any mistakes of this kind and absorb the loss. In your case our casual weekend employee thought that we would chastise her for the loss and take the discrepancy out of her salary (as is the practice in most Vietnamese businesses-but not ours*)Thus she emailed you personally, without discussing the issue with the store management even though she knew that our policy is that the only avenue of complaint dialogue we use is between management and customer. * Our official store policy and ethos is that we do NOT and have NEVER made employees repay money lost during customer transactions and in this case the employee has apologized to us for her action but has not been penalized monetarily or job security wise. We are an ethical business and give all employees far above average salaries, double time salaries on weekends and holidays, bonus payments for official major holidays, plus two weeks fully paid annual leave. On top of this we offer employees medical assistance. In our seventeen years of operation we have never had to sack an employee. Our book prices, as you stated, may sometimes seem high but ths is not to rip off customers but reflects our staff salaries, the high rent we pay for a site in a prestigious area in Hanoi, and the fact that we pay people one third the price of their second hand books that we sell them for. Similarly costs of new books are inflated by taxes and other costs that we have to absorb. I hope that this explanation, plus the personal email sent to you, may offset the understandable upset that your visit to our premise caused you and we apologize humbly for the inconveniences suffered. Regards Truong-The Manager/Owner, Bookworm
Written September 17, 2018
This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of Tripadvisor LLC.
